column4: can i use fetchmail to get mail from my two gmail accounts and then somehow pipe them to spamassassin and then place them in a mailbox in my home dir to be accessable by thunderbird?
Where would be the proper channel to ask fetchmail related questions?
Can you set up fetchmail to get your mail and then pipe it through spamassassin, and then place it in a maildir or mbox in your home dir so you can check it with thunderbird?
I don't think you can with Thunderbird
I know you cant pipe with thunderbird, hence why I want to use fetchmail.  I think itd be some kind of fetchmail/procmail recipie, but just looking for verification
well I really havn't used TB but from what I have seen it dosn't to want to know about local mail spools etc.
sure it does, what real mail client wouldn, it does spools of all sorts
hmm! I am interested. How do you get read from /var/mail?
you just choose unix mail spool(movemail) and tell it your box location
is that part of that set wizard thing?
yeah
is that part of that setup wizard thing?
yeah(x2)
hehe
too early in the morning to have to answer twice ;)
I'll check it out some time. I've only ever used mutt and mail with exim, fetch and co.
gotcha

I think I might go back to s&c gtk, but mozilla came out with the lightening addon(a calandar like sunbird) whiich integrates nicely, and its not all bloat like evolution, but the spamassassin deal has me by the jewels(family)
